title: Lesson 43 – More Noun Phrases, Reported & Direct Speech

contents.markdown: In this lesson we will discuss more noun phrases and introduce you to reported speech. One way to enrich a sentence is to replace a noun with a noun phrase.

item.tagalog: mga maaalat na pagkain
item.english: salty foods

item.tagalog: pusa ni Maria
item.english: Maria’s cat (cat of Maria)

item.tagalog: ang nagluluto ng manok
item.english: the one cooking chicken

item.tagalog: ang babaeng nagluluto ng manok
item.english: the woman cooking chicken

contents.markdown: <u>Forming Noun Phrases from various Parts of Speech </u>
Here is a very versatile way to form noun phrases.

item.tagalog: Kumain ako ng mainit.
item.english: I ate a hot one. (ng + adj)

item.tagalog: Asawa ko ang nasa bahay bukas.
item.english: My wife is the one who will be home tomorrow. (ang + nasa phrase)

item.tagalog: Sabihin mo ang totoo sa nagbigay.
item.english: Tell the truth to the one who gave. (sa + verb)

contents.markdown: \*\*Sinabi\*\*+ Speaker + Linker + Phrase = Speaker said that phrase.

item.tagalog: Sinabi kong hindi mabilis ang sasakyan mo.
item.english: I said that your car is not fast.

item.tagalog: Sinabi ni Angel na pupunta si Maria sa Pilipinas.
item.english: Angel said that Maria will go to the Philippines.

item.tagalog: Sinabi nila sa aking taga-Seattle ang guro.
item.english: They told me that the teacher is from Seattle.

contents.markdown: Notice that the same structure works for other verbs:

item.tagalog: Sinagot kong hindi mabilis ang sasakyan mo.
item.english: I answered that your car is not fast.

item.tagalog: Naisip ni Angel na pupunta si Maria sa Pilipinas.
item.english: Angel thought that Maria will go to the Philippines.

item.tagalog: Naalala nilang taga-Seattle ang guro.
item.english: They remembered that the teacher is from Seattle.

item.tagalog: Sabi ko, hindi mabilis ang sasakyan mo.
item.english: I said your car is not fast.

item.tagalog: Sabi ni Angel, pupunta si Maria sa Pilipinas.
item.english: Angel said Maria will go to the Philippines.

item.tagalog: Sabi nila sa akin, taga-Seattle ang guro.
item.english: They told me the teacher is from Seattle.

contents.markdown: You can use the same structure for other roots:

item.tagalog: Tingin ko, nasa bahay si Joe.
item.english: I think Joe is home.

item.tagalog: Alam ko, ibinili niya nito si David.
item.english: I know she bought this for David.

item.tagalog: *Sa tingin ko, maganda siya.
item.english: I think she is beautiful.

contents.markdown: *Because it is more colloquial, we will use _sa tingin ko_ rather than _tingin ko_.

We call this the “short form”. To be consistent, in the sample sentences **we will use the long form when “that” is used in the English translation, and the short form when it is not**. More on the short form in a future lesson.
The same structure, with quotation marks, is used to quote direct speech in Tagalog:

item.tagalog: Sabi ko, “Hindi mabilis ang sasakyan mo”.
item.english: I said, “Your car is not fast”.

item.tagalog: Sabi ni Angel, “Pupunta si Maria sa Pilipinas”.
item.english: Angel said, “Maria will go to the Philippines”.

item.tagalog: Sabi nila sa akin, “Taga-Seattle ang guro”.
item.english: They said to me, “The teacher is from Seattle”.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Baka alam niya ang itinuro talaga ni Sir Santos.
exampleSentences.english: Maybe he knows the one Mr. Santos really pointed out.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Sabi ni Maria, hindi ilalagay ni Joe ang aso sa labas dahil sa ulan.
exampleSentences.english: Mary said Joe will not put the dog outside due to rain.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Sinabi kong gusto naming itanim ang mga puno bawat Pebrero.
exampleSentences.english: I said that we (excl.) want to plant the trees each February.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Ikopya mo siya ng mga tanong na tungkol sa halo-halo.
exampleSentences.english: Copy her the questions about halo-halo.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Sa tingin nila, ihinahanap ni David ng basketbol si Angel.
exampleSentences.english: They think David is looking for a basketball for Angel.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Sinabi ni Mark na ikinuha mo ako ng mangga.
exampleSentences.english: Mark said that you got me a mango.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Tagasaan ang nasa loob ng kuwarto ni Jessica?
exampleSentences.english: Where is the one inside Jessica's room from?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Sabi ko, "Ikaw ba ang sikat na asawa ng pangulo?"
exampleSentences.english: I said, "Are you the famous wife of the president?"

exampleSentences.tagalog: Sinagot niyang bawal siyang mag-aral sa ilalim ng lamesa.
exampleSentences.english: She answered that she is prohibited from studying under the table.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Sinubukan niyang magbisikleta papunta sa Maynila.
exampleSentences.english: He tried to bicycle to Manila.
